results.title: A City in the country: Albury Wodonga development
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: With forty-two percent of the Australia’s population in Sydney and Melbourne, there is a need for decentralization. Because of this, the government has acted to create a new growth area near the border of Victoria and New South Wales. This film studies the many factors involved in planning a new community.
results.title_for_label: A City in the country: Albury Wodonga development

results.title: A City called Copenhagen
results.creator_credit: Jorgen Roos, Minerva Films and Danish Government Film Office
results.brief_description: An informal portrait of Copenhagen, emphasising the poetry and picturesqueness of everyday life. Among the delightful scenes and pictures are municipal dances in the park, the Tivoli Gardens, the old people’s town, children at the pantomime, fishermen and an artist at the docks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jorgen Roos, Minerva Films and Danish Government Film Office

results.title: A City awakens
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film showing the sights and sounds of a city as it gradually comes to life in the early morning. The film begins before dawn until each part awakens. As the city prepares for the day, the rhythm builds and builds.

results.title: A City and it's problems = Problemes d'une ville
results.brief_description: Discusses the problems facing paris, in particular, the needs of a growing population without sacrificing it’s heritage value.

results.title: A City's child
results.creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Experimental Film and Television Fund of the Australian Council for the Arts and Kavanagh Productions
results.brief_description: An award-winning dramatic treatment of individual loneliness in a large city. Monica Maughan plays a spinster approaching middle age who lives with a dominating mother. After the death of her mother, unable to make human contact, she slips into a fantasy world in which a small doll becomes her “daughter”. The film was shot on 16mm for about $30,000.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Kavanagh, Experimental Film and Television Fund of the Australian Council for the Arts and Kavanagh Productions

results.title: A Citizen of Singapore
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt, Malayan Film Unit and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Through the story of a seven-year-old, Hung Swee Kiat, the film outlines the scope and progress of Singapore’s Ten Year Development Scheme to provide free education for all children, regardless of race and creed. The film closes with official ceremonies at a youth rally which concluded Education Week, during which exhibitions and displays brought the Scheme to the notice of the public.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Salt, Malayan Film Unit and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: A Circus story
results.creator_credit: Marshall Riggan, Major Carpenter, Barr Films and Marshall Majors Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the arrival, setting up and the performance of a circus in the small town of Berrybille, Arkansas, USA. Discusses the status, role and function of the circus today and suggests reasons for the romantic appeal of the circus. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: A Circle is determined by three points
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”.
The three degrees of freedom of a circle - the radius and the co-ordinates of the centre - are reduced stage by stage until finally three points are given. Animated diagrams.

results.title: A Chronic problem
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film considers the chronic patient’s right to quality care, and the acutely ill patient’s right to a hospital bed. Jean is suffering from multiple sclerosis and is almost completely paralyzed. It seems that the only ones who care about her are the nurses. With the arrival of a patient in need of an operation, it becomes apparent that chronic patients have little priority.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and ONF | NFB
